basic.description: Attending a diverse array of seminars is an essential component in the development of a student, especially in a department as diverse as biology.  The aim of this course is to develop skills in listening, synthesizing and critical thinking, as well as fostering the development of important oral and written communication skills.  Students will be required to attend at least 30 department or specialized research seminars, as well as present a seminar based upon their graduate thesis research.  Enrolment is extended over six terms and is limited to new graduate students in Biology. Y. Wang.
basic.subject: BIOL
basic.title: Seminars In Biology
